definitions: body of water partly enclosed by land with a wide mouth opening to the sea
moderate reddish-brown color resembling that of a bay horse
aromatic leaf from the laurel tree used as a culinary herb
recessed section of a wall or building between vertical supports
deep prolonged barking sound made by hunting dogs
examples: The ship anchored in the calm bay near the harbor
San Francisco Bay connects to the Pacific Ocean through the Golden Gate
She chose a bay leather jacket for the autumn season
The horse had a beautiful bay coat with black mane
Add two bay leaves to the simmering soup for flavor
The chef removed the bay leaves before serving the stew
The library featured a reading bay with comfortable window seats
Each parking bay could accommodate two compact cars
The hounds kept their quarry at bay throughout the night
We could hear the bay of hunting dogs in the distance

definitions: stabbing blade designed to be attached to the muzzle end of a rifle
military close combat technique using a rifle with attached blade
examples: The soldier fixed his bayonet before the final charge
World War I trenches saw extensive use of the bayonet
They practiced bayonet drills during basic training
The regiment executed a bayonet charge against enemy positions

definitions: slow-moving waterway in marshy areas, especially in the southern United States Gulf Coast region
examples: Alligators sunned themselves along the Louisiana bayou
We took an airboat tour through the mysterious bayou waters

definitions: traditional marketplace in Middle Eastern countries with rows of small shops and stalls
fundraising event where goods are sold for charitable purposes
examples: Tourists haggled for carpets in the Istanbul bazaar
The spice bazaar filled the air with exotic aromas
The church bazaar raised funds for the new roof
She donated handmade quilts to the annual charity bazaar

definitions: portable shoulder-fired rocket launcher used primarily against armored vehicles
brand name of bubble gum popular in mid-20th century America
examples: The infantry squad carried a bazooka for anti-tank defense
World War II soldiers nicknamed the weapon bazooka after a musical instrument
Kids loved the comics that came with Bazooka bubble gum
He collected vintage Bazooka gum wrappers from the 1950s

definitions: sandy or pebbly shore along a body of water where land meets sea
designated coastal area for amphibious military operations and landings
examples: Children built sandcastles on the sunny beach all afternoon
The beach stretched for miles along the tropical coastline
Allied forces stormed the beaches of Normandy on D-Day
The marines secured the beach before advancing inland

definitions: land or property directly facing or adjacent to a beach
examples: The beachfront hotel offered stunning ocean views from every room
Property values soared for beachfront homes after the development

definitions: defended position on a beach taken from an enemy by landing forces
initial achievement that provides a base for further advancement
examples: The marines established a beachhead despite heavy resistance
Securing the beachhead took three days of intense fighting
The company gained a beachhead in the Asian market
This small victory could serve as a beachhead for reform

definitions: light or fire signal used for navigation, warning, or communication
person or thing that inspires or guides others through example
examples: The lighthouse beacon warned ships of dangerous rocks
Aircraft beacons flashed red in the night sky
She became a beacon of hope for the community
The university stood as a beacon of learning and progress

definitions: small piece of glass, stone, or similar material pierced for threading
small round drop of liquid formed on a surface
examples: She strung colorful beads to make a necklace
The rosary contained fifty-nine prayer beads
Beads of sweat formed on his forehead during the race
Morning dew created tiny beads on the spider web

definitions: decorative work made by sewing or stringing beads together in patterns
examples: The Native American dress featured intricate beadwork designs
She spent months completing the beadwork on her wedding gown

definitions: small to medium-sized hound dog breed with short legs and long ears
examples: The beagle followed the rabbit's scent through the woods
Snoopy from Peanuts is the world's most famous beagle

definitions: hard projecting jaws of a bird used for eating and preening
person's nose, especially when prominent or hooked
examples: The eagle's sharp beak tore through its prey
The parrot cracked seeds with its powerful beak
The old sailor had a prominent beak that dominated his face
He jokes about his beak but actually likes his distinctive nose

definitions: cylindrical glass container with a pouring lip used in laboratories
large drinking cup or mug, typically without handles
examples: The scientist measured 100ml of solution in the beaker
Glass beakers lined the chemistry lab workbench
Vikings drank mead from ornate metal beakers
The archaeological dig uncovered ancient ceramic beakers

definitions: long sturdy piece of wood or metal used as a horizontal support in construction
ray or shaft of light from a particular source
broad bright smile expressing joy or satisfaction
examples: Steel beams supported the weight of the building
The old barn's wooden beams showed their age
Sunbeams filtered through the forest canopy
The flashlight beam cut through the darkness
She beamed with pride at her daughter's graduation
His face beamed when he heard the good news

definitions: edible seed from various climbing plants used as food
seed of the coffee plant used to make coffee
small amount of something, especially money
examples: She added black beans to the vegetarian chili
Green beans make a healthy side dish
The barista ground fresh coffee beans for espresso
These beans come from a small Colombian farm
I don't have a bean to my name this week
The information isn't worth a bean without proof

definitions: small round tight-fitting knitted cap worn on the head
examples: He wore a wool beanie to keep warm in winter
The hipster's beanie completed his casual outfit

definitions: main stem of a bean plant that grows tall and requires support
examples: The beanstalk climbed up the garden trellis all summer
Jack climbed the magical beanstalk in the fairy tale

definitions: large heavy mammal with thick fur and strong claws
investor who expects market prices to fall and may sell accordingly
examples: The grizzly bear caught salmon in the rushing river
Black bears sometimes wander into suburban neighborhoods
The bear predicted a market crash within six months
Bears dominated trading as stocks fell sharply

definitions: hair growing on the lower part of a man's face
person who diverts suspicion from someone else, especially in romantic contexts
examples: He grew a thick beard during the winter months
The barber trimmed his beard to perfection
She acted as his beard at family gatherings
The celebrity used a beard to hide his true relationship

definitions: person who carries or brings something to others
person who holds or presents a negotiable document
examples: The flag bearer led the Olympic delegation
Ring bearers play an important role in weddings
The check was made payable to bearer
Bearer bonds can be redeemed by whoever holds them

definitions: direction or position relative to a fixed point measured in degrees
machine part that reduces friction between moving parts
person's way of standing, moving, or behaving
examples: The ship maintained a bearing of 270 degrees west
We lost our bearings in the dense fog
The wheel bearing needed immediate replacement
Ball bearings reduce friction in rotating machinery
She carried herself with the bearing of royalty
His military bearing was evident in his posture

definitions: skin and fur of a bear used as material for clothing or rugs
tall black fur cap worn by guards at British royal residences
examples: The cabin featured a bearskin rug before the fireplace
Native peoples traditionally used bearskin for warm winter clothing
The Queen's Guard stood motionless in their bearskin hats
Each bearskin hat weighs about two pounds

definitions: large or dangerous four-legged animal, especially wild or untamed
person who behaves in a cruel or uncivilized manner
something formidable, unpleasant, or difficult to control
examples: Lions are magnificent beasts of the African savanna
Medieval hunters pursued the beast through the forest
He acted like a beast toward his employees
The dictator was a beast who showed no mercy
This old computer is a beast to maintain
The final exam was an absolute beast

definitions: basic rhythmic unit in music or regular rhythm
regular route or area covered by someone on duty
news story reported before competitors
examples: The drummer kept a steady beat throughout the song
Dance music needs a strong beat to move crowds
The officer walked his beat through downtown streets
Her journalism beat covered local politics
The reporter got the beat on the corruption scandal
Their beat made front page news nationwide

definitions: kitchen utensil used for mixing or whipping ingredients
old car in poor condition but still functioning
person who drives game toward hunters
examples: Use an electric beater to whip the cream until stiff
The egg beater made quick work of the meringue
His first car was an old beater that barely ran
The beater got them to work despite its appearance
Beaters flushed pheasants from the undergrowth
The hunting party employed local beaters

definitions: physical attack involving repeated blows or strikes
decisive defeat in competition or conflict
regular pulsing or throbbing movement
examples: The victim survived the beating but needed hospitalization
He received a severe beating from the gang
Their team took a beating in the championship game
The stock market took a beating this quarter
The beating of wings filled the air as birds took flight
She felt the beating of her heart after the sprint

definitions: member of the 1950s-60s youth movement rejecting conventional society for artistic and bohemian lifestyle
examples: Beatniks gathered in coffee houses to read poetry
Jack Kerouac became an icon for beatniks everywhere

definitions: man who is a woman's regular companion or boyfriend, especially in formal contexts
examples: She introduced her new beau at the family dinner
Her beau sent flowers every Friday without fail

definitions: process of making something more attractive or beautiful through enhancement or decoration
examples: The city's beautification project added gardens to every park
Highway beautification included planting trees and removing billboards

definitions: quality of being pleasing to the senses or mind aesthetically
person, especially a woman, who is very attractive
outstanding or excellent example of something
examples: The beauty of the sunset took their breath away
She appreciated beauty in all its forms
The pageant crowned a new beauty queen
She was considered a great beauty in her youth
That goal was an absolute beauty
This car is a real beauty

definitions: large semiaquatic rodent with broad flat tail that builds dams
fur of the beaver used for clothing and hats
person who works very hard and industriously
examples: Beavers built an impressive dam across the stream
The beaver slapped its tail as a warning
Beaver pelts were highly valued in colonial trade
His top hat was made from finest beaver felt
She's a real beaver when it comes to meeting deadlines
The team worked like beavers to finish the project

definitions: style of jazz developed in the 1940s characterized by complex harmony and fast tempo
examples: Charlie Parker revolutionized bebop with his saxophone playing
Bebop musicians gathered at Minton's Playhouse in Harlem

definitions: piece of furniture for sleeping or resting, typically with mattress and frame
bottom of a body of water or the foundation of something
area of ground prepared for planting flowers or vegetables
layer of rock or sediment in geological formations
examples: She bought a new bed with a memory foam mattress
The child refused to go to bed before nine
Oysters grew on the ocean bed near the reef
The river bed dried up during the drought
She planted tulips in the flower bed by the fence
The vegetable bed produced tomatoes all summer
Geologists studied the coal bed formations
The limestone bed dated back millions of years

definitions: bedroom, especially a large or stately one in historical contexts
examples: The queen's bedchamber was decorated with silk tapestries
Servants were not allowed in the royal bedchamber

definitions: sheets, blankets, and other coverings used on a bed
material used by animals for sleeping or nesting
examples: She changed the bedding every week without fail
The hotel provided luxury bedding for all guests
The hamster gathered bedding material for its nest
Fresh straw bedding kept the horses comfortable

definitions: scene of uproar and confusion characterized by noise and disorder
examples: The classroom erupted into bedlam when the fire alarm rang
It was absolute bedlam at the store during Black Friday sales

definitions: solid rock underlying loose deposits of soil and sediment
fundamental principles or core foundation of something
examples: They drilled through clay until hitting bedrock
The building's foundation rests on solid bedrock
Trust forms the bedrock of any good relationship
These values are the bedrock of our democracy

definitions: room in a house or apartment used primarily for sleeping
examples: The master bedroom had an ensuite bathroom attached
They painted the spare bedroom for the new baby

definitions: space immediately adjacent to or next to a bed
examples: She kept a glass of water on her bedside table
The doctor maintained a gentle bedside manner with patients

definitions: time at which someone typically goes to bed to sleep
examples: The children's bedtime was eight o'clock sharp
She read a bedtime story to her daughter every night

definitions: flying insect that collects nectar and pollen and produces honey
social gathering for a specific purpose or activity
examples: Bees buzzed around the flowering apple tree
The bee returned to its hive laden with pollen
The community held a quilting bee every month
They organized a spelling bee for local students

definitions: large deciduous tree with smooth gray bark and small edible nuts
examples: The ancient beech tree provided shade for generations
Beech forests turn golden in autumn months

definitions: wood from beech trees used in furniture and construction
examples: The cabinet was crafted from solid beechwood
Beechwood makes excellent flooring due to its hardness

definitions: meat from cattle, especially adult cows or bulls
complaint or grievance about something
muscular strength or body mass
examples: The restaurant served prime beef with roasted vegetables
Ground beef is the main ingredient in hamburgers
What's your beef with the new policy?
He had a legitimate beef about the service
The bodybuilder added serious beef over the winter
He's got the beef to play defensive line

definitions: photographs or images of muscular men, or such men themselves
examples: The calendar featured beefcake photos of firefighters
He was cast as beefcake in the action movie

definitions: structure where bees live and produce honey
woman's tall rounded hairstyle popular in the 1960s
place full of activity and busy people
examples: The beekeeper carefully opened the beehive to collect honey
Wild bees built their beehive in the old oak tree
Her beehive hairstyle required an entire can of hairspray
The beehive was the signature look of the 1960s
The office was a beehive of activity before the deadline
The market becomes a beehive on Saturday mornings

definitions: person who maintains bee colonies for honey production or pollination
examples: The beekeeper wore protective gear while inspecting hives
Local beekeepers supplied honey to the farmer's market

definitions: practice of maintaining bee colonies for honey production or crop pollination
examples: Beekeeping requires knowledge of bee behavior and seasons
She took up beekeeping as a retirement hobby

definitions: short high-pitched electronic sound used as a signal or alert
examples: The smoke detector's beep woke everyone at night
Leave a message after the beep on the answering machine
